titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frank Jenks theater program collection 1992.023
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-22T10:29-0500

did.abstract: Programs from various Brooklyn theaters operating during the late 19th century. Theaters represented include the Brooklyn Academy of Music, the New Park Theatre (also known as Colonel Sinn's New Park Theatre, or as simply the Park Theatre), the Brooklyn Theatre, the Brooklyn Grand Opera House, Haverly's Theatre, Hyde & Behman's, and F.F. Proctor's Criterion Theatre.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Frank Jenks theater program collection, 1992.023, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: A complete listing of theaters represented in the collection, as well as the dates of all included programs, is available in paper form at the Othmer Library. Please consult library staff for more information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related archival collections at the Brooklyn Historical Society:

list.item: 1977.049, Brooklyn Theatre Fire Relief Association Records, 1876-1879
1977.205, Brooklyn and Manhattan theater and concert programs scrapbook, 1875-1885
ARC.138, Brooklyn Institute of Arts and Sciences publications and ephemera, 1877-1998
